item.title: CI Implementations with Tekton Resolvers and Pipelines As Code
item.description: Overview For sometime now we have been, together with DevOps empowered application teams and DevOps engineers, using the OpenShift Pipelines, OpenShift's productised version of tekton.dev, as the Continuous Integration (CI) technology of choice when onboarding new applications or migrating existing ones into Red Hat's kubernetes. Recently, the article on Migration from ClusterTasks to Tekton Resolvers in OpenShift Pipelines by colleagues Vincent Demeester and Koustav Saha and the GA of Pipelines as code prompted me to perform a refresher on the resources used as a baseline when starting a completely new implementation/migration or introducing the topic of tekton to a team.
